name: luminescence
content:
Add to word list

chemistry, physics
  specialized the giving out of light by a substance that has not been heated: A variety of lighting elements are used, from LED to chemical luminescence. Compare
incandescence
literary soft light: The car headlights lit the driveway with a pool of bright luminescence. The table-lamp threw a soft luminescence across the chair. See
luminescent
More examplesFewer examplesThe artifacts were dated using optically stimulated luminescence. The ocean often emits a visible glow, or luminescence, which extends for miles at night. They toil over the perfect shade of pigment, the architectural details of an elaborate building, the luminescence of a wine glass.
